com.conceptwave.scripting
Class Global

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.Global

public class Global
extends CWScriptable

List of miscellaneous static methods that can be used in any script.

The following constants are defined:

  • Global.STOP_UI - closes the Object Window.
  • Global.SET_ROOT - refer to Global.setCurrentObject documentation.
  • Global.SET_PARENT - refer to Global.setCurrentObject documentation.
  • Global.SET_CURRENT - refer to Global.setCurrentObject documentation.

Method Detail

addBMCounter

public static void addBMCounter(String name,
                                com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean visibleInJMX,
                                com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean dontCreateNew)
Deprecated. As of 5.0. Will be removed in 6.0. Use 'AddBenchmarkCounter' method in the AVM object

Creates a new benchmark counter. A benchmark counter is a synchronized object with unique name that accumulates performance data. The counter must be created before it is used. Creating a counter with given name will remove the existing counter with the same name and will create a new one. The benchmark counter has four properties: start time, end time, counter and histogram. The counter allow to record the increase (or decrease) of a measured item. A positive or negative increment can be specified. The benchmark counter can collect histogram data in a minute interval for 24 hours. The histogram data collection starts when the start histogram date is set. At that moment the existing histogram data is erased. The histogram reflects the increase or descrease of the measured item for the current minute. After reaching 24 hours of histogram data the histogram data collection stops. It can be restarted by setting new start date. The histogram data collection can be stopped if the end histogram time is set. In this case the existing histogram data is preserved and can be obtained by API. The bechmark counters can be made visible in the JMX and if so they can be used in the statistics monitoring.

Parameters:
name - The counter name. Must be unique in the system. If the counter with the same name already exists it will be destroyed.
visibleInJMX - Optional parameter. If true the counter will be visible in Benchmark type under the JMX domain name.
dontCreateNew - Optional parameter. If true and conter with the same name exists it will be returned

appendWithFirstCaps

                                         String str2)
Appends strings making first character of second string uppercase. For example: Global.appendWithFirstCaps("short", "ticketDetail") returns "shortTicketDetail".

Returns:

Parameters:

Returns:
XML string representing the object list. Empty array returns null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if error during the XML generation.

beginTransaction

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer beginTransaction(String databaseName)
Increases the transaction level or starts the transaction if there is no currently an open transaction for the specified database (the transaction level is 0). The database transaction has a level parameter. Every call to beginTransaction increases the level while every call to commitTransaction decreses the level. The real database commit transaction operation is performed when the transaction level becomes 0.

Parameters:
databaseName - The database name as specified in the configuration utility. If the database name is not defined throws a run-time exception DE0168.
Returns:
1 if another transaction for the database already have been started or 0 otherwise.

clearAlarm

public static void clearAlarm(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer notificationID,
                              String resourceID,
                              String jmxNotifType,
                              String message)
Send a fault event to clear an alarm to - NGEE(Next Generation Execution Environment) FM(Fault Management) when AVM is running on NGEE - JMX console "CWAVMAlarm" MBean under JMX Domain name To add a new alarm, the following steps are required 1. Defined a new alarm in the /opt/ngee/latest/base/conf/AvmFmInstances_mp.xml file 2. Add a new error code(even number) in the /opt/ngee/latest/base/conf/AvmAlarmsDefs.xml file 3. Add new notification IDs in /opt/ngee/latest/base/conf/NgeeInstances_mp.xml (one for RAISE_ALARM - same as error code in step 2 and one for CLEAR_ALARM - error code in step 2 + 1 ) for the alarm in step 1

Parameters:
notificationID - id that matches to the one defined in the ECIM(Ericsson Common Information Model) model on NGEE it's in /opt/ngee/latest/base/conf/NgeeInstances_mp.xml
resourceID - SNMP(Simple Network Management Protocol) OID(Object Identifier) For example, (all Ericsson domain components starts with "1.1.1") "1.1.1.21.1" for AVM (registered component ID on ECIM registry for AVM is "21") "1.1.1.11.1" for NGEE OAM (registered component ID on ECIM registry for NGEE is "11") "1.1.1.11.1.1" for NGEE SM "1.1.1.11.1.2" for NGEE CM "1.1.1.11.1.3" for NGEE PM "1.1.1.11.1.4" for NGEE FM
jmxNotifType - JMX alarm notification type An alarm will be cleared on com.conceptwave.AVM -> CWAVMAlarm MBean with this JMX notification type An example: "com.conceptwave.AVMNTFALARM.DatabaseDownOrUnreachable"
message - the description of fault message

commitTransaction

public static void commitTransaction(String databaseName)
Decreases the transaction level and commits the transaction to the specified database if transaction level becomes 0. The database transaction has a level parameter. Every call (explicit or implicit) to beginTransaction increases the level while every call to commitTransaction (explicit or implicit) decreses the level. The real database commit transaction operation is performed when the transaction level becomes 0.

Parameters:
databaseName - The database name as specified in the configuration utility. If the database name is not defined throws a run-time exception DE0168.

convertToTimeZone

public static Date convertToTimeZone(Date date,
                                     String timezone)
Converts the given date to the same absolute time for the given timezone Eg. If given date is Jan 6 2012, 06:00 at GMT-4, and the given timezone is the equivalent of GMT+2 Then the result date would be Jan 6 2012, 06:00 at GMT+2, or equivalently at Jan 6 2012, 00:00 at GMT-4.

Parameters:
date - The given date, in local timezone
timezone - The timezone to convert the date to
Returns:

generateInterfaceMessage

public static String generateInterfaceMessage(String interfaceName,
                                              String operationName,
                                              CwObject[] params,
                                              String conversionmap)
Generates a service specific interface message. Should be used in combination with Global.sendInterfaceMessage().

Parameters:
interfaceName - Fully qualified metadata name of the interface.
operationName - Name of the interface operation
params - Interface parameters. Can be a single data object or array of data objects. The data object can be document or data structure. The first (or only) data object must be of the same type as the metadata interface operation parameter. HTTP Clients: If an array of two data objects is specified, the children/leaves of the second one will be used to set HTTP headers. Any data objects after the second are ignored. SOAP Clients: If an array of two or more data objects are specified, objects after the first MAY be used in conjunction with the metadata binding Input parameter "header" to generate soap headers. If no metadata parameter is specified, all data objects after the first WILL be added as SOAP headers. If the "header" parameter is specified in metadata, only the second data object MAY be used to generate a SOAP header (Please see the metadata documentation for SOAP bindings for a description of the "header" parameter). The rest will be ignored.
conversionMap - Fully qualified name of the conversion map. If specified, then it will override the map specified in bindings.
Returns:
Service specific string representation of the outgoing message generated by this interface. No message is actually delivered on the interface. SOAP: Entire Soap Envelope. HTTP: HTTP request body for POST operations. NULL for GET operations or for empty input data. JMS/MQ: Message text or NULL for empty input data. JAVA/JS/LDAP/SMTP/DB/TIBCO/FTP: NOT Supported.

getCTCodesAndDescriptions

public static String[] getCTCodesAndDescriptions(String codeTable,
                                                 String lang,
                                                 Date absDate,
                                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean activeOnly,
                                                 com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean ascendingOrder)
Gets the list of all codes and descriptions for a given DB enumeration (standard DB code table) and given language. The code and the corresponding description are stored as two adjacent elements in the array.

Parameters:
codeTable - The DB code table name
lang - Optional. A language code as defined in the system configuration utility. If null or not specified the current user language will be used.
absDate - Optional. Versioned code table request time. If not specified or null the last stored Catalog API time will be used, if Catalog API time is null the current timestamp will be used. Versioned code table is only available when catalog is running.
activeOnly - Optional. A flag indicates that only the active code will be returned in the code table.
ascendingOrder - Optional. with value of true, the return result will be sorted in ascending order, otherwise, order will be in dscending order.
Returns:
Array of all codes and description in the code table sorted by description. If "User Sort Order" is selected and sortorder is filled out, the API returns an array of all codes and description in the code table sorted by sortorder field.If the code table is not found or is empty returns null.

public static String getDVEErrorMessage(String errorDescriptor,
                                        String resourceType,
                                        String languageCode)
Gets the validation message for a given DVE error descriptor.

Parameters:
errorDescriptor - The DVE error descriptor
resourceType - The message resource type. Should be more than 2 characters long
languageCode - Two or five letter language code. Should match exactly a labguage code in the application language list. If not specified or null the language of the current user will be used.
Returns:
Returns the formatted message for the given error descriptor. If the error descriptor is incorrect returns "E_WRONG_DESCRIPTOR: " + error descriptor; If the message does not exist returns "E_NO_MESSAGE: " + error descriptor.

Throws:

getItemsFromXML

public static Array getItemsFromXML(String xml,
                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Object param)
Converts an XML string to list of data objects - documents orders or data structures.

Parameters:
xml - XML string.
param - Can be a fully specified document type, namespace or null. If the parameter is fully qualified metadata document name the input XML string is scanned for the instances of that document type and array of documents are returned. If the parameter is namespace name the top level element of the XML string is considered to be order, data structure or document of this namespace. If such metadata element exists it is converted to data object and an array of one element is returned. If no metadata element mactches the top level XML element null is returned. If the parameter is null then the xmlns element of the XML is used to find the corresponding metadata namespace. If found the result is the same as if the namespace name is specified. If no matching namespace is found or xmlns element is not specified null is returned.
Returns:
Array of data objects or empty array.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws different I/O or data format exceptions.

smAttribute - The statistics attribute name of the JMX attribute as appearing in the JMX console in square brackets at the end of the attribute description
Returns:
The current value of the JMX attribute or null if the statistics attribute is not found

getNextIdForName

public static String getNextIdForName(String seqName)
Returns the current sequential id for the specified counter and increments the counter. Many different counters can be created. No database sequence objects are needed. Caution: This function should be used only if there is a need to generate sequential numbers for many groups different objects - for example if you want to number independently the orders for every customer. Do not use this function to generate system-wide sequence numbers that are often needed because getNextIdForName uses database locks and can potentially create a deadlock. In such case you should create Oracle sequence and use the function nextInSequence(sequence name).

Parameters:
seqName - Name of the counter. Can be up to 128 characters long.
Returns:
The counter value is incremented and returned as string. If the counter does not exist creates a new counter with the specified name and returns 1.

invokeFinder

public static void invokeFinder()
Deprecated. As of 4.1. Will be removed in version 6. Use Funder.runFinder method. Note that Funder.runFinder method does not return array.

Invokes an operation of a finder.

Parameters:
finderName - Fully qualified metadata finder name
oper - Operation. Can be one of the "select", "get", "add", "delete" or "update"
sDoc - Parameter for the operation - a data document or null. For "select" operation sDoc represents the search document, for "get" operation - a result document with the document key fields/document id set, for "add" operation the new document to be added, for "delete" operation - the document to be deleted (only the document key fields/document id are needed) and for "update operation - the document to be updated.
notUsed - Deprecated optional parameter that is not used

invokeInterface

public static Array invokeInterface(String interfaceName,
                                    String operationName,
                                    CwObject[] params,
                                    String conversionmap)
Calls an interface operation.

Parameters:
interfaceName - Fully qualified metadata name of the interface.
operationName - Name of the interface operation
params - Interface parameters. Can be a single data object or array of data objects. The data object can be document or data structure. The first (or only) data object must be of the same type as the metadata interface operation parameter. HTTP Clients: If an array of two data objects is specified, the children/leaves of the second one will be used to set HTTP headers. Any data objects after the second are ignored. SOAP Clients: If an array of two or more data objects are specified, objects after the first MAY be used in conjunction with the metadata binding Input parameter "header" to generate soap headers. If no metadata parameter is specified, all data objects after the first WILL be added as SOAP headers. If the "header" parameter is specified in metadata, only the second data object MAY be used to generate a SOAP header (Please see the metadata documentation for SOAP bindings for a description of the "header" parameter). The rest will be ignored.
conversionMap - Fully qualified name of the conversion map. If specified, then it will override the map specified in bindings.
Returns:
An array of one or more data objects returned by the interface operation or null.

invokeInterfaceUsePE

public static void invokeInterfaceUsePE(String interfaceName,
                                        String operationName,
                                        CwObject[] params,
                                        String messageGroupId,
                                        String conversionmap,
                                        String callbackFunction,
                                        String msgCorrelationId,
                                        com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean returnErrorToCallback)
Sends participant message to the interface to invoke interface operation. In case of Request-Response operation, the response is not immediate, but comes asynchronously in the callback function when interfaces receives response and invokes callback.

Parameters:
interfaceName - Fully qualified metadata name of the interface.
operationName - Name of the interface operation.
params - Interface parameters. Can be a single data object or array of data objects. The data object can be document or data structure. The first (or only) data object must be of the same type as the metadata interface operation parameter. HTTP Clients: If an array of two data objects is specified, the children/leaves of the second one will be used to set HTTP headers. Any data objects after the second are ignored. SOAP Clients: If an array of two or more data objects are specified, objects after the first MAY be used in conjunction with the metadata binding Input parameter "header" to generate soap headers. If no metadata parameter is specified, all data objects after the first WILL be added as SOAP headers. If the "header" parameter is specified in metadata, only the second data object MAY be used to generate a SOAP header (Please see the metadata documentation for SOAP bindings for a description of the "header" parameter). The rest will be ignored.
messageGroupId - Optional string that must have the same value for all messages that have to be processed on one and the same PE in the strict sequence of their arrival in the DB. An order id, customer number, etc. can be used for this purpose. If null or missing a random correlation id will be used and the message is not guaranteed to be processed in strict order and on the same PE compared to any immediately preceding or following message.
conversionMap - Fully qualified name of the conversion map. If specified, then it will override the map specified in bindings.
callbackFunction - Fully qualified name of a metadata global script. This script should accept two parameters. Parameter one will be a response data object. The type of the data object will either be the response object defined for the interface operation or it will be "cwf:error" in the event of an error during invocation of the interface. The type of the object can be checked with CwObject.isBasedOn(). Parameter two will be the msgCorrelationId passed into the call to this method if provided. Null otherwise. Mandatory for Request-Response interface operation. For all other operation types it is optional and will only be called when an error occurs and "returnErrorToCallback" is true.
msgCorrelationId - Optional, A string id used to link a response message with its request message.
returnErrorToCallback - Optional, A boolean flag. if true, any exception/error happened during interface calls would be passed to the callback function as the first parameter (response), which is wrapped as 'cwf:error' data structure. The callback function should have some extra check to handle this error data structure.

invokeJMX

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object invokeJMX(String host,
                                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer port,
                                                         String objectName,
                                                         String methodName,

                                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] params)

invokes the specified JMX method

Parameters:
objectName - The name of the JMX object.
methodName - The name of the JMX method to invoke.
port - JMX port
host - JMX host
attr - boolean parameter - get the specified attribute/invoke method
params - parameters we want to sent to the method. Can be null
Returns:
The result of the JMX method/get attribute invocation

isMethodDefined

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isMethodDefined(Scriptable object,
                                                                String name)
Returns true if this object has the specified method. This method can be used to check existence of system defined API methods as well as Metadata defined scripts.

Parameters:
object - Scriptable object used as the starting point for the method search. NOTE: To check for the existence of static, system defined methods this argument must be the static object; this includes Global Scripts in namespaces. eg: Global.isMethodDefined(Global, "invokeInterface"); Global.isMethodDefined(Document, "readDoc"); Global.isMethodDefined(cwt_common, "copy_array"); To check for the existence of methods defined in the global scope, this argument should be NULL. eg: Global.isMethodDefined(null, "printf");
name - Method name to search for.
Returns:
true if method is defined; false otherwise.

isPropertyDefined

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean isPropertyDefined(Scriptable object,
                                                                  String name)
Returns true if this object has the specified property. This method can be used to check existence of system defined API properties as well as Metadata defined variables, children, etc. IMPORTANT: This method does not check the value of a property, only whether it or not it is defined in the object's prototype. A property value may be set to NULL or UNDEFINED, but this method will still return true for that property name.

Parameters:
object - Scriptable object used as the starting point for the property search. NOTE: To check for the existence of static, system defined properties this argument must be the static object. To check for the existence of globally defined properties this arugment should be NULL. eg: Global.isPropertyDefined(null, "theDocumentCache")
name - Property to search for.
Returns:
true if property is defined; false otherwise.

leftPad

public static String leftPad(String str,
                             com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer length,
                             String fill)
Deprecated. as of 4.1. Use method 'leftPad(int length, String fill)' of the string object. The string object method returns null instead of throwing exception if the 'fill' parameter is invalid

Pads a string from the left with the specified character.

Parameters:
str - String to be padded. If the string is null it is considered an empty string.
length - The length of the result string (in characters).
fill - The fill string. Must be exactly one character long. If not an exceptionn is thrown.
Returns:
The string with the specified length. If the string length is less than the requested length the string is padded on the left with the fill character. If the string length is greater than the requested length the original string is returned.

logDebug

logError

public static void logError(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object message,
                            String id)
Logs a JE0003 message (Script error message: ...) to the console or into the event log. Works for scripts log level ERROR and above. WARNING: In Version 5 and above this API does not any more return the id of the error message in the system event log.

Parameters:
message - A string that describes the error or script error object. If it is the script error message the stack trace of the exception will be available in the event log.
id - Id of the object for which the error occurred or null.

Logs message to the console. The method parameter is used as message parameter - it is converted to string and included in the mesage text. Intended for debug purposes only. Works only if the scripts log level is debug. In Designer command line mode, will always logs the message into console.

Parameters:
param - String Message parameter.

logTrace

public static void logTrace(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object param)
Logs message to the console only (DB Logging does not support TRACE). The method parameter is used as message parameter - it is converted to string and included in the mesage text. Intended for detailed debug purposes only. Works only if the scripts log level is TRACE or ALL.

Parameters:
param - String Message parameter.

logWarn

public static void logWarn(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object param)
Logs message to the console or into the event log. The method parameter is used as message parameter - it is converted to string and included in the mesage text. Intended for debug purposes only. Works only if the scripts log level is WARN or lower.

Parameters:
param - String Message parameter.

nextInSequence

public static String nextInSequence(String sequenceName)
Returns next value from the specified sequence.

Parameters:
sequenceName - The sequence's name. Should be an existing sequence in the Oracle "Order" database.
Returns:
The next numeric value from the sequence converted to string. The values returned by successive calls to the same sequence are in ascending sequence but not mandatory sequential.

normalizeKeywords

public static String normalizeKeywords(String str)
Normalizes a string for keyword searching using the Oracle CONTAINS clause. Lower case is converted to uppercase, leading and trailing whitespace is removed, non-alphanumeric characters are removed and a run of whitespace is converted to a single whitespace (all non-alphanumeric characters count as whitespace). Each keyword is perfixed with the soundex (!) and stem ($) operators and multiple keywords are separated with the accumulate operator (,). For more information regarding the Oracle CONTAINS clause, please refer to the Oracle documentation. For example: " Database error. " becomes "!$DATABASE,!$ERROR".

Parameters:
str - Keyword string to normalize.
Returns:
Normalized keyword string.

normalizeString

public static String normalizeString(String str)
Normalizes a string for sorting and searching. Lower case is converted to uppercase, leading and trailing whitespace is removed, non-alphabetic characters are removed and a run of whitespace is converted to a single whitespace (all non alphabetic characters count as whitespace). For example: " IBM Canada Inc. " becomes "IBM CANADA INC".

Parameters:
str - String to normalize.
Returns:
Normalized string.

raiseAlarm

public static void raiseAlarm(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer notificationID,
                              String resourceID,
                              String jmxNotifType,
                              String message)
Send a fault event to raise an alarm to - NGEE(Next Generation Execution Environment) FM(Fault Management) when AVM is running on NGEE - JMX console "CWAVMAlarm" MBean under JMX Domain name To add a new alarm, the following steps are required 1. Defined a new alarm in the /opt/ngee/latest/base/conf/AvmFmInstances_mp.xml file 2. Add a new error code(even number) in the /opt/ngee/latest/base/conf/AvmAlarmsDefs.xml file 3. Add new notification IDs in /opt/ngee/latest/base/conf/NgeeInstances_mp.xml (one for RAISE_ALARM - same as error code in step 2 and one for CLEAR_ALARM - error code in step 2 + 1 ) for the alarm in step 1

Parameters:
notificationID - id that matches to the one defined in the ECIM(Ericsson Common Information Model) model on NGEE it's in /opt/ngee/latest/base/conf/NgeeInstances_mp.xml
resourceID - SNMP(Simple Network Management Protocol) OID(Object Identifier) For example, (all Ericsson domain components starts with "1.1.1") "1.1.1.21.1" for AVM (registered component ID on ECIM registry for AVM is "21") "1.1.1.11.1" for NGEE OAM (registered component ID on ECIM registry for NGEE is "11") "1.1.1.11.1.1" for NGEE SM "1.1.1.11.1.2" for NGEE CM "1.1.1.11.1.3" for NGEE PM "1.1.1.11.1.4" for NGEE FM
jmxNotifType - JMX alarm notification type An alarm will be raised to JMX Domain name -> CWAVMAlarm MBean with this JMX notification type Example: "com.conceptwave.AVMNTFALARM.DatabaseDownOrUnreachable"
message - the description of fault message Example: "AVM, Database "ORDER" is down or unreachable"

resetAutoTransaction

public static void resetAutoTransaction(String databaseName,
                                        com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean throwException)
Turns off the auto-transaction mode for the specified database. The database transaction contain 'level' parameter. Every call (explicit or implicit) to beginTransaction API increases the level while every call to commitTransaction API (explicit or implicit) decreases the level. The database commit operation is performed when the transaction level becomes 0. The default auto-transaction mode automatically set the transaction level to 1 for each database before the top level script is executed. This way all database operations in the script (and all scripts it calls, etc.) are performed as single database transaction. If the auto-transaction mode is turned off the top level transactions in the script will be commit to the database. In order to turn off the auto-transaction mode however no database operations with the current database should have started. If that is not the case calling this method has no effect at all and all database operations will be performed as single transaction in the top-level script. The mode will remain turned off until the very top level script finishes, i.e. script0 calls script1 and script2, script1 resets the auto-transaction, in this case it will be reseted also for script2 and will stay like that until script0 finishes. The programmer can control the execution of this method by specifying the optional second parameter "throwException". We strongly recommend to set this parameter to 'true' in which case if the method cannot set the auto-transaction mode off it will generated exception.

Parameters:
databaseName - The database name as specified in the configuration utility. If the database name is not defined throws a run-time exception DE0168.
throwException - Optional boolean flag. If true the method will throw exception DE4435 if the specified database already has open transaction.
Throws:
Run - -time exceptions DE0168 if the database name is not defined and DE4435 if DB has already open transaction

resetFocusField

public static void resetFocusField()
Forces browser to set current focus to the first editable field.

rethrowException

public static void rethrowException(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object exception,
                                    String code,
                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] param)
Re-throws/throws an application exception. The execution of the script is canceled. The thrown application exception is of type CwfException with the specified code and parameters. Of the exception parameter is not null it will be added as a parent of the CwfException exception. Both the new and parent exceptions will be logged as a single record in the system log.

Parameters:
exception - Exception to be re-thrown (may be null).
code - Code of the application exception (may be null).
param - Parameter of the application exception message. May be a string, array of strings or null.
Throws:
CwfException

rightPad

public static String rightPad(String str,
                              com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer length,
                              String fill)
Deprecated. as of 4.1. Use method 'rightPad(int length, String fill)' of the string object. The string object method returns null instead of throwing exception if the 'fill' parameter is invalid

Pads a string from the right with the specified character.

Parameters:
str - String to be padded. If the string is null it is considered an empty string.
length - The length of the result string (in characters).
fill - The fill string. Must be exactly one character long. If not an exception will be thrown.
Returns:
string If the string length is less than the requested length the string is padded on the right with the filling character. If the string length is greater than the requested length the original string is returned.

public static void rollbackTransaction(String databaseName)
Immediately rollbacks the transaction in the specified database. Immediate rollback happens too if there is an exception during a database operation in the transaction.

Parameters:
databaseName - The database name as specified in the configuration utility. If the database name is not defined throws a run-time exception DE0168.

runContentDisplayScript

public static void runContentDisplayScript(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object userActionController,
                                           String scriptName)
The method is used to simulate "postInvoke" action for metadatas migrated from 4.2.
It goes throuhg all displayed documents starting from top window and calls "displayScript" method if exists.
In 5.1. the logic of the document's "Display" script should be moved to the corresponding menu/button User Action Method.

5.1 used for Migration only

runDBStoredProcedure

public static Array runDBStoredProcedure(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object database,
                                         String callSQL,
                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] parameters,
                                         String resultDocument,
                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean autoCommit,
                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean bindNullLeafs,
                                         String outDocument,
                                         String inoutFlag)
Runs a database stored procedure.

Parameters:
database - the database name as specified in the configuration utility or instance of DatabaseConnection. If the database name is not defined throws a run-time exception DE0168.
callSQL - A SQL call statement. May contain parameters (specified by question mark, and after question mark, may followed with parameter types, valid parameter type is: {T}, {D}, {t}. {T} is for Datetime type {D} is for Date type. {t} is for Time type.) Example: {call sp(?,?,?)}, exec sp ?,?,?,? {call sp(?{T},?, ?{t}} The SQL syntax/format might be different in different JDBC drivers and Databases.
parameters - A data document containing the parameters for the SQL statement or string, or array of strings or null. If the parameter is a data document: if bindNullLeafs is false, only the non-null data from the document is assigned positional from left to right to the parameters of the SQL statement. if bindNullLeafs is true, all data from the document is assigned positional from left to right to the parameters of the SQL statement. If the parameter is a string: it is considered to be the only parameter of the SQL statement. If the parameter is an array: it has to contain only non-null strings that are positional assigned from left to right to the parameters of the SQL statement. It is the caller's responsibility to assign just as many non-null values in the document or string array as parameters are in the SQL statement.
resultDocument - Fully qualified name of the metadata document to be used to return the result set of the stored procedure. If null, the call will not return the result. resultDocument does not need to be mapped to DB: if not mapped to DB, we are going to map the returned ResultSet to all leaves one by one; if mapped to DB, we are going to map the returned ResultSet ONLY to the leaves which are mapped to DB.
autoCommit - autoCommit flag to the database connection to run the stored procedure.
bindNullLeafs - boolean If true will bind empty leafs as 'NULL' parameter
outDocument - Fully qualified name of the metadata document to be used to return the out parameter of the stored procedure. it is optional.
inoutFlag - 'I','O','C' flags with '-' as splitter, such as 'I-O-I-O-I', 'I-I-O','I-IO-O', 'I-IO-C-O'. It is optional. 'I' means in parameter, 'O' means out parameter, 'C' means cursor type out parameter 'IO' means in-out parameter (this flag for in-out parameter can not be 'OI', should be 'IO' - the order matters). The position of 'I','O','IO' or 'C' represents the parameters position in stored procedure. Only support ONE cursor out-parameter.
Returns:
null or an array which contains array of the resultDocument(if applicable) and an outDocument(if applicable). If resultDocument is specified, and stored procedure returns a resultset or/and has REFCURSOR type out-parameter, returns an array of the resultDocument. the cursor result would append to the array after resultDocuments from resultset. If the stored procedure has out-parameters, and the outDocument is specified, the outDocument returned from out-parameters would be added at the end of the array. return null if neither the resultDocument nor the outDocument is not specified.

runDBUpdate

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer runDBUpdate(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object database,
                                                            String sql,
                                                            com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] parameters,
                                                            com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean bindNullLeafs)
Executes an SQL statement, which must be an SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statement, such as INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE; or an SQL statement that returns nothing, such as a DDL statement.

Parameters:
database - the database name as specified in the configuration utility or instance of DatabaseConnection. If the database name or connection is not defined throws a run-time exception.
sql - A SQL statement. May contain parameters (specified by question mark, and after question mark, may followed with parameter types, valid parameter type is: {T}, {D}, {t}. {T} is for Datetime type. {D} is for Date type. {t} is for Time type.)
parameters - A data document containing the parameters for the SQL statement or string, or array of strings or null. If the parameter is a data document only the non-null data from the document is assigned positionally from left to right to the parameters of the SQL statement. If the parameter is a string it is considered to be the only parameter of the SQL statement. If the parameter is an array of strings it has to contain only non-null strings that are positionally assigned from left to right to the placeholders of the SQL statement. It is the caller responsibility to assign just as many non-null values in the document or string array as parameters are in the SQL statement.
bindNullLeafs - boolean If true will bind empty leafs as 'NULL' parameter
Returns:
Number of the updated database records.

runDVE

public static Array runDVE(CwObject obj,
                           String setName,
                           com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer maxErrors)
Validates a data object

Parameters:
obj - Data object. Can be Document, Order or Data Structure object
setName - The validation set name. If null the data object metadata mane will be used.
maxErrors - Maximum number of errors. After reaching this number the validation engine will exit
Returns:
Empty array if no errors are found; Array of error descriptors if errors are found or null if the Data Validation Engine is not started (initialized) or the object is not Document, Order or Data Structure

runFinder

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object runFinder(String finderName,
                                                         String oper,
                                                         Document sDoc)
Deprecated. As of 4.1. Use Finder.runFinder method. Note that the Finder method uses the current finder search document if the search document parameter is null.

Invokes the specified operation of a finder. If the operation is 'select' the search initialization script is performed.

Parameters:
finderName - Fully qualified metadata finder name
oper - Operation. Can be one of the "select", "get", "add", "delete" or "update"
sDoc - Parameter for the operation - a data document or null. For "select" operation sDoc represents the search document, for "get" operation - a result document with the document key fields/document id set, for "add" operation the new document to be added, for "delete" operation - the document to be deleted (only the document key fields/document id are needed) and for "update operation - the document to be updated.
Returns:
DataObjectList if "select" operation, Document or null if "get" operation and null for any other operation. The data object list maintains the result complete status of the "select" operation.

runRTRule

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Object runRTRule(String ruleName,
                                                         Document[] param,
                                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object nRecords,
                                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object nonExclusive)
Runs a rule.

Parameters:
ruleName - Fully qualified runtime rule name. If the specified name is not found or is not a runtime rule throws exception.
param - A document or array of documents that are rule parameters. Some of them may be null.
nRecords - A maximum number of results in a finder rule. Not used for the initialization rules.
nonExclusive - If null the non-exclusive flag from the metadata is used. If boolean the true value indicates non exclusive run and false - exclusive. If finder rule is not specified a system-defined maximum is used.
Returns:
The data object list if finder rule, the result value if action rule. Returns null if initialization rule or no rule has fired.

runSQLQuery

public static DataObjectList runSQLQuery(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object database,
                                         String resultDocName,
                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer maxRows,
                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] parameters,
                                         String sql,
                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean bindNullLeafs,
                                         String nlsComp,
                                         String nlsSort,
                                         com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer timeoutSec)
Runs a query in the specified database and returns the result as a scriptable data object list.

Parameters:
database - the database name as specified in the configuration utility or instance of DatabaseConnection. If the database name or connection is not defined throws a run-time exception DE0168.
resultDocName - Fully-qualified metadata name of the result document.
maxRows - Maximum number of documents in the data object list.
parameters - A data document containing the parameters for the SQL statement or string, or array of strings or null. If the parameter is a data document only the non-null data from the document is assigned positionally from left to right to the parameters of the SQL statement. If the parameter is a string it is considered to be the only parameter of the SQL statement. If the parameter is an array of strings it has to contain only non-null strings that are positionally assigned from left to right to the placeholders of the SQL statement. It is the caller responsibility to assign just as many non-null values in the document or string array as parameters are in the SQL statement.
sql - A SQL select statement. May contain parameters (specified by question mark, and after question mark, may followed with parameter types, valid parameter type is: {T}, {D}, {t}. {T} is for Datetime type. {D} is for Date type. {t} is for Time type.)
bindNullLeafs - boolean If true will bind empty leafs as 'NULL' parameter
nlsComp - Oracle NLS_COMP
nlsSort - Oracle NLS_SORT
timeoutSec - The number of seconds to wait for a Statement object to execute. If the limit is exceeded, SQLException is thrown.
Returns:
A CwfDataObjectList object that may be empty. The result completion flag of the data object list is set correspondingly.

sendEmailMessage

public static void sendEmailMessage(String from,
                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Object to,
                                    String subj,
                                    String msg,
                                    String mime,
                                    String encoding,
                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Object bcc,
                                    String[] attachInfoArr,
                                    String user,
                                    String psw,
                                    String host,
                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Object port,
                                    com.conceptwave.scripting.Object secure)
Sends an e-mail message with optional attachments extracted from document attachments or files

Parameters:
from - Sender e-mail address.
to - Receiver e-mail address. Could be a String or an Array of addresses in format: [to][cc][bcc] Example: ["a@email.com, b@email.com","c@email.com","d@email.com"] ["a@email.com, b@email.com",null,"d@email.com"] ["a@email.com, c@email.com"] "a@email.com"
subj - Subject.
msg - E-mail text.
host - E-mail server host. If null, system defined SMTP server configuration will be used. This includes host, port, user, password and ssl.
mime - MIME format.
user - User name for the mail server.
psw - Password for the mail server.
port - SMTP port to use (default 25)
attachInfoArr - - array of document or file attachment information in format [atachmentId_1, attachmentName_1, attachmentMimeType_1, ... ,attachmentId_N, attachmentName_N, attachmentMimeType_N ]. if atachmentId is null, attachmentName represents fileName, the attachmentName could be a path relative to resource, ie: /cwf/about.png.
secure - true if SMTP server uses secure commnunication (SSL)
encoding - Character encoding to use, default UTF-8
bcc - if true, uses receiver(s) email(s) as BCC Use function Global._getDocumentAttachments(Document doc) to obtain data in this format. However, all document notes would be ignored.

sendInterfaceMessage

public static Array sendInterfaceMessage(String interfaceName,
                                         String operationName,
                                         String message)
Delivers a previously generated interface message on the specified interface. Should be used in combination with Global.generateInterfaceMessage().

Parameters:
interfaceName - Fully qualified metadata name of the interface.
operationName - Name of the interface operation
message - Text form of the message to be delivered on this interface. NOTE: The SOAP service requires that the message passed be a fully specified and valid SOAP Envelope. Expectation is that the message was generated with a call to Global.generateInterfaceMessage() with a SOAP interface specified.
Returns:
An array of one or more data objects returned by the interface operation or null.

sendInterfaceMessageUsePE

public static void sendInterfaceMessageUsePE(String interfaceName,
                                             String operationName,
                                             String message,
                                             String messageGroupId,
                                             String callbackFunction,
                                             String msgCorrelationId,
                                             com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean returnErrorToCallback)
Calls an interface operation via Process Engine Instead of directly calling the interface, put the messages/calls to the participant (CWPPARTICIPANT) table, and wait for the Interface Process to consume it. This method will not get the interface response instantly, in order to get interface response later after the Interface Process consumes the request, callbackFunction/msgCorrelationId need to be specified.

Parameters:
interfaceName - Fully qualified metadata name of the interface.
operationName - Name of the interface operation.
message - Text form of the message to be delivered on this interface.
messageGroupId - Optional string that must have the same value for all messages that have to be processed on one and the same PE in the strict sequence of their arrival in the DB. An order id, customer number, etc. can be used for this purpose. If null or missing a random correlation id will be used and the message is not guaranteed to be processed in strict order and on the same PE compared to any immediately preceding or following message.
callbackFunction - Fully qualified name of a metadata global script. This script should accept two parameters. Parameter one will be a response data object. The type of the data object will either be the response object defined for the interface operation or it will be "cwf:error" in the event of an error during invocation of the interface. The type of the object can be checked with CwObject.isBasedOn(). Parameter two will be the msgCorrelationId passed into the call to this method if provided. Null otherwise. Mandatory for Request-Response interface operation. For all other operation types it is optional and will only be called when an error occurs and "returnErrorToCallback" is true.
msgCorrelationId - Optional, A string id used to link a response message with its request message.
returnErrorToCallback - Optional, A boolean flag. if true, any exception/error happened during interface calls would be passed to the callback function as the first parameter (response), which is wrapped as 'cwf:error' data structure. The callback function should have some extra check to handle this error data structure.

setBMCounterProperty

public static java.lang.Long setBMCounterProperty(String name,
                                                  com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer property,
                                                  com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer value)
Deprecated. As of 5.0. Will be removed in 6.0. Use the corresponding API of the BenchmarkCounter object

Sets a property of a benchmark counter. Depending on the property type specified in the call the API does the following: 1) Starts counting. Sets the start time. Counting is automatically started on first increment operation. 2) Stops counting. Sets the end time. Once the counting is stopped the counter value cannot be changed any more 3) The counter value is incremented by one. 4) The benchmark counter value is increased (or decreased) with the value of the third parameter.

Parameters:
name - The counter name. The counter should have already been created by addBMCounter call.
property - The property id should be one of: 1 - start counting, 2 - stop counting, 3 - increment counter, 4 - increase the counter value.
value - The property value. Applies only for property id 4. For the other property id is not needed and may be omitted.
Returns:
A long integer value of the counter for property 3 and 4. Zero otherwise.

setDisplayTimeZone

public static com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean setDisplayTimeZone(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object param,
                                                                   com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean absolute)

Use this method to change the timezone used to display date-time values in the UI. To re-set the default timezone, pass in a parameter null or -1.

The first parameter must be either the time zone ID, ex. "America/Vancouver", "EST" or the GMT offset ("GMT-05:00") or an integer offset in minutes (ex, 300 for GMT-05:00).
Pass "server" or 999 to force using the server time zone.

NOTE: The actual time zone ID set as the display time zone might be diffrent from the original ID passed as param.
The reason is that the client supports only a subset of time zone IDs supported by Java.

setDisplayTimeZone() translates the passed time zone name into one of the supported IDs or parses the integer offset. In case if if the ID is not supported by client but is supported by Java, then it uses the absolute offset given by Java time zone object.

Parameters:
param - Time zone ID or an integer offset in minutes.
absolute - If true and "param" is an integer offset, the offset is the absolute offset from GMT.
If not specified, null or fasle, the offset is a relative offset between server and client time zones (5.2 behaviour).
Returns:
true if the display time zone changed
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - with code "DE0640" if the time zone ID is not supported or unable to parse the offset

setSemaphore

public static void setSemaphore()
Deprecated. As of 4.1. Use setSemaphore method of the AVM object

Sets a semaphore value if the semaphore exists.

Parameters:

value - New semaphore value if the "newValue" parameter is null, otherwise - expected current semaphore value. Can't be null.
newValue - If not null this parameter value will be set as current semaphore value only if the current value of the semaphore strictly matches a value of the "value" parameter.

throwSoapFaultException

public static void throwSoapFaultException(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object param,
                                           String code,
                                           String strMessage)
Throws a SOAP Fault exception. This method should ONLY be used in a script that directly processes a SOAP LISTENER request (ie. invoked directly by the listener or by a indirectly by another script that was invoked by the listener. Execution of the script will be canceled at the point this method is called, and the SOAP Message provider will construct an appropriate SOAP response based on the WSDL type selected in Listener's Service Metadata object. This method only supports setting the fault detail and fault string/reason for a SOAP fault. The fault code will be set to a default value based on WSDL Type. For WSDL 1.1, the fault code will be set to "{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Server". For WSDL 1.2, the fault code will be set to "{http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/}Recipient".

Parameters:
param - MANDATORY. An instance of an Data Object used to define the SOAP Fault detail. The type of the Data Object should match or extend the type defined as the fault message for the Interface Operation. Depending on the WSDL type this value will also be used to populate the faultstring or fault reason elements.
code - Not used. May be used in future implementations.
strMessage - Not used. May be used in future implementations.
Throws:
CwfUserException

throwUnknownError

public static void throwUnknownError(String code,
                                     com.conceptwave.scripting.Object[] param)
Throws a interface based exception indicating a Unknown process error. MUST ONLY be called in a script handling a message received by a listener or a script invoked with the JS Service Provider Interface. NOTE: No special handling of this exception exists in the framework as of this version.

param - Parameter of the message. May be a string, array of strings or null.

translateText

public static String translateText(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object resId,
                                   String lang,
                                   String[] params,
                                   com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean returnNullIfNotFound)
Gets the translation of the given resource for the specified language. Optionally adds parameters into the resource translation.

Parameters:
resId - Resource id. The application resource ids have structure "Aseveritynumber", where severity is one of the letters - "S" - severe error, "E" - error, "W" - warning and "I" information and the number is a for digit number. Example - "AE0045".
lang - The language code or null. The language code should be the same as in the system configuration. If null or not in the list of languages the default language is assumed.
params - String array of strings that replace the parameter placeholders in the translated message. The parameter placeholders in the translation are specified as {0} to {9}.
returnNullIfNotFound - true/false flag If the resource is not found, and this flag is true, return null, if the flag is false, return the resource id followed by the parameters (if any).
Returns:
The resource translation. If the resource is not found returns the resource code followed by the parameters (if any).

validate

public static Array validate(CwObject interfaceData,
                             String schemaLocation)
Validate interface data xml against an Xsd schema. NOTE: The XML generated from the provided data object may not be strictly valid by default. You may need to modify either the Namespace or data object XML settings or both. if you get 'cvc-elt.1: Cannot find the declaration of element...', normally means top element declaration of a complexType is missing in the schema, or 'Include namespace' and 'Element' are not checked in your metadata object xml setting.

Parameters:
interfaceData - Interface data object.
schemaLocation - Path to schema file relative to the metadata resources directory.
Returns:
list of errors
